data.title: Fabio Tinazzi on LinkedIn: A first exciting step towards plug&play drives in the pump industry…
data.meta_description: A first exciting step towards plug&play drives in the pump industry applications. The current control algorithm does not need motor parameter information, and…
data.text:
Si è concluso il primo della serie di sei seminari intitolata "Explore the Frontiers of AI Application in Research" organizzata per il Corso di Dottorato in Meccatronica e Innovazione Meccanica del Prodotto. Il seminario è stato tenuto dal prof. Oliver Wallscheid dell’Università di Siegen (Germania) e ha trattato il tema molto attuale dell’utilizzo del reinforcement learning in applicazioni relative all’elettronica di potenza e agli azionamenti elettrici, fornendo i necessari fondamenti teorici e gli ultimi risultati della ricerca in questo settore. Circa 30 studenti (in presenza e in remoto) hanno potuto apprezzare le ultimissime frontiere della ricerca relativamente all’utilizzo dell’intelligenza artificiale, con esempi nel mondo delle microreti e nel controllo di azionamenti elettrici. ____ The first (out of a series of six) seminar of the cycle "Explore the Frontiers of AI Application in Research" organised for the PhD course in Mechatronics and Mechanical Product Innovation at the DTG has come to an end. The seminar was held by Prof. Oliver Wallscheid from the University of Siegen (Germany), and it dealt with the very important subject of how to use reinforcement learning techniques in AI applications relating to power electronics and electrical drives. The seminar has provided the necessary theoretical foundations and the latest research results in this field. Thirty students (both in attendance and remotely) have appreciated the latest research results about the use of artificial intelligence in the electrical energy engineering field, with particular care for microgram systems and the advanced control of electrical drives. #dtg #unipd #terzamissione #ingegneria #Vicenza #AI #Research #Seminars #DeepLearning #MachineLearning #Robotics #Innovation Università degli Studi di Padova Universität Siegen Daria Battini Giulio Timelli

I’m glad to share with you the paper: “aVsIs: An Analytical Solution-Based Solver for Model Predictive Control With Hexagonal Constraints in Voltage Source Inverter Applications” that has been accepted by the IEEE Transactions on Power Electronics. The early-access version can be found at https://lnkd.in/d2DRP2HG. The proposed solver allows finding the optimal constrained solution within one control period horizon in Model Predictive Control algorithms for every three-phase voltage source inverter. The maximum number of calculations is known and since it doesn’t require any iterations in the procedure it can be also implemented in FPGA platforms. The code and its future developments are available under Apache 2.0 license at https://lnkd.in/daeKKBtR.
